channel.title: Please help!
channel.description:
ok i have Pr0digy scape and when i run this comes up:
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: server at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) Could not find the main class: server. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .
please help?

item.title: Please help!
item.dc:creator: @Samih1996 Samih1996
item.description:
@Samih1996 wrote:

jmk600:

ive friggin compiled like 80 times… in both client and source…

You said that the compiling error is in the client. So i tink u should sort the client out not the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help!
item.dc:creator: @jmk600 jmk600
item.description:
@jmk600 wrote:

ive friggin compiled like 80 times… in both client and source…

Read full topic

item.title: Please help!
item.dc:creator: @Samih1996 Samih1996
item.description:
@Samih1996 wrote:

In your server folder there should be a folder called “Data” somewhere i am not sure where. Anyway if you have edited the NPC or Item bonus or anything else and it has errors that might have caused that. Thats what happend with mine.
There is a coding error in your source but you can’t tell which .txt or .java it is.

I really think that the people above have no right to post, If a server gets a error saying:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: server
        at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
        at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
        at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
Could not find the main class: server.  Program will exit.
Press any key to continue . . .

That means there is a coding error in data folder or somewhere else.

If there is a error saying something like:

The system cannot find the path specified.
Press any key to continue . . .

Then there is something wrong with the .bat in your client or server folder.

You said that you have the error in client. So it is confusing, A client normaly doesn’t say errors like that… I think that you should undo whatever you did and then save and compile.

Good Luck

Read full topic

item.title: Please help!
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Oh… Dear.

[quote=“Sanskrit, post:11, topic:368235”][quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=464388.msg3396284#msg3396284 date=1289424946]
You could use this:

@echo off title myserver "C:/Program files (x86)/java/jdk1.6.0_**/bin/java.exe" -Xmx1000m client 10 0 highmem members 32 pause

Just change ** to JDK version.
[/quote]

I think the arguments in your snippet are for a client, i could be wrong though.

Btw, check that the main class “server” isn’ t actually “Server”, because Java is case sensitive :P[/quote]
That was for the server, I just managed mine differently.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help!
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

You could use this:

@echo off title myserver "C:/Program files (x86)/java/jdk1.6.0_**/bin/java.exe" -Xmx1000m client 10 0 highmem members 32 pause

Just change ** to JDK version.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help!
item.dc:creator: @Sanskrit Sanskrit
item.description:
@Sanskrit wrote:

So your having problems with the server run.bat, not the client run.bat, correct?

Read full topic

item.title: Please help!
item.dc:creator: @Sanskrit Sanskrit
item.description:
@Sanskrit wrote:

Do you have a 32 bit or 64 bit Operating System? If its 32, change your client run.bat to this:

@echo off title myserver "C:/Program files/java/jre6/bin/java.exe" -Xmx256m client 10 0 highmem members 32 pause

Read full topic

item.title: Please help!

item.description:

pause

i tried

title myserver
“C:/Program files (x86)/java/jre6/bin/java.exe” -Xmx256m client 10 0 highmem members 32
pause
